page.title: 11WELBURY&DEIGHTON W.I.'S
page.content: One constant activity in both villages is the Women's Institute. This is a national organisation for country women, non-sectarian and non-political, with the aim of encouraging country crafts and skills,and promoting new interests. Membership hovers around 20. Each month a speaker is invited to the meeting, and topics cover a wide range such as the work of the Stock Exchange, healthy eating and medieval churches. The monthly meetings provide a chance for social contact which might otherwise not exist. The village groups funtion independently, with occasional area meetings in Northallerton and national annual meeting at the Albert Hall in London.
